metadata.feature_description: Multi-language support for page management interface

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify UI strings are localized in default language

steps.action: Navigate to Pages module in PersonaBar
steps.expected: Pages panel opens with all UI elements displaying localized strings
steps.actual: Pages panel opened successfully. All UI labels displayed in English including: Pages heading, Add Page, Add Multiple Pages, Save Page Template buttons, Details/Permissions/Advanced tabs, and all field labels (Name, Title, Description, Keywords, Tags, Parent Page, Small Icon, Large Icon, Display in Menu, Workflow, Link Tracking, Enable Scheduling, Start Date, End Date)

steps.action: Verify resource key values from EvoqPages.resx are displayed correctly
steps.expected: Resource strings like WorkflowTitle.Text, LinkTrackingTitle.Text, On.Text, Off.Text should display in UI
steps.actual: All resource key values verified: 'Workflow' label displayed (WorkflowTitle.Text), 'Link Tracking' label displayed (LinkTrackingTitle.Text), 'On'/'Off' toggle values displayed correctly, 'Save Page Template' (SaveAsTemplate.Text equivalent) displayed. Full page view captured showing the localized strings in context.

observations: Only English (en-US) localization exists in EvoqPages.resx - no other language-specific resource files (e.g., EvoqPages.es-AR.resx, EvoqPages.fr-FR.resx) were found in the codebase

The site has multiple language options (English, Spanish, French, German, Arabic) available at the portal level, but the Pages module UI would remain in English as fallback since no translations exist
All UI strings from EvoqPages.resx are properly rendered in the Pages module interface without any missing resource key errors or raw key display
Resource file contains approximately 40 localization entries covering workflow, templates, publishing, filtering, and page management UI elements
